SENT.plain: A 33 year-old woman developed eclampsia with HELLP syndrome
Laboratory results revealed lupus anticoagulant and anticardiolipin antibodies
Imaging tests showed liver and spleen infarctions
The patients was given enoxaparin and supportive care and there was a good evolution
We discuss some aspects about liver infarction and its association with toxemia of pregnancy and the antiphospholipid syndrome
